Reviews.Content: stay away!! bed bugs!! Okay so I guess they are closing at the end of this month for renovations according to the staff. I just hope that when they re-open they will have gotten rid of all the BED BUGS that bit the heck out of my legs!! They most certainly need renovations, everything is REALLY run down, dirty  basically needs replacing. I understand that they were closing for renovations but that does not mean the staff needs to be rude. They basically had an I DONT GIVE A [--] attitude. I did not expect Ritz Carlton Service or anything of the sort, but I've honestly gotten better service at the 99 cent store. I was so upset my husband finally convinced me to let it go and think of it as an adventure. I literally wanted to go to another hotel, unfortunately there were 3 HUGE conventions that week and we could not find any availability. We tried to go the hotel just to sleep so we could avoid any dissapointments. But then we got Bitten!! Literally, by Bed Bugs! The entire 4 days we stayed there the Bed lineds were not changed, I know this because the first day I spilled some make-up powder on the bed and it left a little stain. The stain was there the whole time, even after I called the front desk and asked to have the linens changed. They basically shewed me off with a yeah yeah and never did anything! I will never stay at any Clarion gain! I chose it because they have a decent reputation but never again!! Beware even after renovations, they will change their name so be careful! They are on the corner of Jackson  St,. Charles
Reviews.Author: muradgirl

Reviews.Content: Yeah Problems Here I wont waste time writting about this place just read the other reviews they are true not all of them happened to us but talked to people and it happened to them. We got bed bug bites from this place. This place is closing in a month for major renovations.
Reviews.Author: SunnyCali

Reviews.Content: Garden District Hotel needs IMPROVEMENT! Great Location! Right on St. Charles Avenue! Lobby is very attractive! Now, for the negative! When I visited there was only one elevator working and this was used by staff and guests. There were MANY times that the elevator was too crowded (the max was 6 people) and I had to either wait or take 5 flights of stairs to my 5th floor room. The room I stayed in had no clock of any kind, paper cups instead of glass coffee cups, and if you wanted to have internet access or use of the gym facility you had to pay a fee of around $5.95. If you didn't care about the gym or internet you still had to pay a fee of $5.95! The sink in our room, #516, did not drain. The tub drained but it was VERY SLOWLY! We called the front desk to have them aware of this around 8:30 am. When we returned to our room at 4 pm the sink was still clogged. 15 minutes after returning to the room there was a knock on the door from staff wanting to unclog the sink, well since we were headed to the French Quarter I was occupying the bathroom getting ready. Staff said they would return in 15 minutes. We got back to hotel at 11 pm that night...sink STILL clogged. We called downstairs, staff came up and sucked the water out of the sink and said it was fixed. Next morning when we brushed our teeth, etc, sink became full of water again and still did not drain! I woke up Sunday morning at 7 am with guests screaming and vomiting in hallways, and Saturday when I went downstairs to buy a soda I encountered a prostitute and guest in the elevator. If you are going to N.O. to party and have no children then this is a great hotel. If you are bidding on priceline and can get this hotel cheap, then this is an okay hotel. If you are paying full price for this hotel then you are making a huge mistake! I would stay at this hotel again ONLY IF I bid on it at priceline and was forced to, I WILL NEVER pay full price for this stay!
Reviews.Author: ACDUPREE

Reviews.Content: do not stay here!!!! Stayed here during Mardi Gras. air conditioner did not work. Took three days to get a new room,which was on the last night of the stay-pure misery. mold on bathroom ceiling,tub did not drain. The icing on the cake was getting stuck on the pre historic elevator.Will never go back. do not waste your money,sleep on the street instead.
Reviews.Author: falcon2007

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for PROS:- location (within Garden District, and right on the St Charles Streetcar line)- free internet accessCONS:- old (elevator felt like it was about to break, blocked drains in the bathroom, broken hairdryer)- lack of cleanliness (had a mini roach in my bed)
Reviews.Author: pekoUSA

Reviews.Content: Danger, Will Robinson! I would never return to this hotel, even if they paid me. We stayed here for Mardi Gras. Not our first by any means, and we understand that the crowds put pressure on properties and their staff. Things won't always run smoothly, we get hat. I try to be laid-back about the little challenges, and cut people some slack. In return, I'd appreciate being treated with at least simple courtesy. Unfortunately, that is hard to find in the Avenue Garden Hotel. At least with the front desk staff. From the first minute I walked up to the desk, the attitude was that I was a problem and should be treated as such. Hi, I'd like to check in, please was greeted with sullen hostility. Over and over again, the staff provided incorrect information -- if I weren't trying to be polite here, I'd say they liked repeatedly. Like making us move rooms after the first night. In their defense, we made 2 separate reservations, one for the first night and one for the next 4. But I explained when checking in, and spent 10-15 minutes so they could find a room we allegedly wouldn't have to move out of after night one Next morning (after I unpacked 2 suitcases), they informed us we'd have to move but couldn't yet say what room might be available. Okay, mistakes happen -- but wouldn't an apology for the inconvenience be in order? Not from these folks. Actually, other than the front desk and manager, staff were friendly and trying to do a good job. That is, security and cleaning staff. It was not a 100% horrible experience. Good things about the property: locationfree parkingpricelinens not visibly dirtylobby bathroom generally clean and no lines (important during parades)The guy stuck on security duty at the front door all weekend was very friendly and professional while doing a sometimes unpleasant job (keeping out people who aren't registered guests)Bad things:one unreliably working elevator, one out of service permanentlymy room had only hot water, which made showers and tooth-brushing interesting.Did I mention the staff's lousy attitude?I have travelled extensively, in this country and abroad, and am hard-pressed to recall ever being treated so badly by a hotel. Including those in the then-Soviet Union, and the scary place in Florida that made us promise not to engage in prostitution during ourt stay.
Reviews.Author: ejkdc

Reviews.Content: Pay the extra 20$ and stay at Maison St Charles just down the street! The elevator situation mentioned in a 2007 review is still in effect -- take the working elevator at your own risk; the doors don't close all the way and are likely to leave you stuck until someone tells you the trick is to press the floor button to reopen and try again. The (non smoking?) room smelled, the bed folded in on itself, and the internet which they charge a $5 fee for didn't work... Nothing about this place was worth paying 68$ a night. I moved to an affiliated hotel down the street for only a little more per night and the difference was 100% worth the extra cash, and with the same location.
Reviews.Author: potterse

Reviews.Content: Go somewhere else This hotel is NOT a 3 star hotel. Let me repeat, it is NOT a 3 star hotel. The first thing you notice when walking into this hotel is the lack of customer service. While Beverly is a fantastic lady, unfortunatley she repersents the worst hotel I鈥檝e ever stayed in (Beverly, you should consider working in a nicer place that will appreciate your skills.) Let me walk you through our adventure. As we were waiting to check in, the phone at the front desk was ringing off the hook, all seemingly for complaints about the air/heat in the rooms. We were told that we had a smoking room, though we did not want one (we didn鈥檛 complain 鈥?we were still trying to have a positive attitude). Heading up on the elevator that was old, graffiti ridden, and frankly, scary, we looked at each other, wondering what could possibly await us in Room 501. Walking into the room, we quickly noticed the ripped walpaper, the bad smell, the broken heat AND TV, and, the worst of all, the U shaped bed (the mattress was so old it seemd to fold up like a raft.) Me and my sweetie slept huddled together in the valley of the U shaped mattress. I鈥檓 not kidding. Other highlights? The stained, lopsided lampshades, the broken fridge, the torn curtains, and the NON WORKING TV all added up to a very disappointing night in the Big Easy. Complaints will likely get you some more pillows, but not a new, comfy bed.If you can aviod this place, by all means, do so. It ruined our vacation. Pay an extra $50 bucks and stay somewhere you know will be comfortable.
Reviews.Author: Mugsy1227

Reviews.Content: Great potential We stayed on January 30th in 2 rooms for my mother's birthday. We were concerned about the previous reviews, but looked on our stay as an adventure. It was an adventure. First impressions of the lobby were this looks nice. The rickety elevator added charm, the nicely decorated, very smoke smelling room was something else. My sisters moved accross the hall in a not so nice room. No working shower and water logged ceiling areas. Our room had no working air conditioner/heater and bare bulb in the ceiling fixture. The tub looked dirty, but our shower worked. The good things were very comfortable beds , the location and the great view from our window. The continental breakfast was a pre-packaged muffin, coffee and a pitcher of water. My sister said she would stay here again if the price was right. I'm not so sure.
Reviews.Author: RockinRobin56

Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here We arrived to find our NON-smokng room so smoke filled that I immediately went to front desk to inquire, They said they would send someone to take care of problem - Someone did come and pour some orange smelling stuff around the floor which only make it worse - Anyway, was severe thunderstorm going on so turned on TV to check weather and guess what - TV did not work.At 3:45 a.m. could not take smell any longer - got up to shower and leave and NO HOT WATER. Went to call front desk and the phone did not work so went to front in PJs to complain and was told she was only one on duty and could not help. The room was large enough and could have been nice but it looked like it had been used for Katrina victims and not cleaned since. The room was FILTHY. Also only one very scary elevator worked in this hotel and the parking lot very small and they charged to park plus a 5.95 per night resort fee for the phone and internet which was funny since our phone did not work. This is the first review I have ever written which should speak for itself. I thought Clarion would be upper class of the Choice Hotel Line - The only positive thing is that my money was refunded - I was informed by mail after my return home but that does not make up for lost sleep - TAKE MY ADVICE AND STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL-
Reviews.Author: taffytoes

Reviews.Content: Don't even THINK of staying here! The only decent thing about this hotel is the location on St. Charles Ave on the street car line, but given the hundreds of other hotel choices in New Orleans, don't let this be the only factor in your decision. Yes, you only get what you pay for, and although the rate was extremely low for this time of year, I would hate to think about anyone paying top dollar when tourist season is high. I reserved two rooms for family members on hotels.com and after seeing the condition of the hotel and the rooms in person, had to find other accomodations before my family even checked in, so the two rooms were paid for all weekend and never used. Oh, well, so much for trying to save a little money..believe me, I won't go into detail about this place, but save yourself the disappointment and spend the extra $50.00 and get a nice room at a real Boutique Hotel in New Orleans of which there are many. Hotels.com should be a lot more aggressive in the star ratings for hotels in their system as this is rated at 2.5, when in actuality it is a solid 1 star at most!
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansTraveler93

Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE I booked my hotel in August through a booking agency. Over two months in advance of my stay. The hotel sent me an e-mail confirming my reservation, and I paid up front in September.I hit heavy traffic driving to New Orleans, so I called the hotel around 3 pm to say I wouldn't be there until about 11 pm. The girl said that was fine, she would note me as a late book in, and that everything was ready for my arrival.I get to the hotel around 11pm or so, and many people are walking out mad. I get to the front desk, and the girl told me they had no rooms and she was sending me to the JW Marriott down the street, no extra fees required. That was fine, but I asked how that happens.She said just because I booked through an agency doesn't mean it guarantees my room cause they didn't block out the reservation, and they book on a first come first serve basis. How August is not first, I have no idea. The girl was very rude to me. She then told me that they were only putting me somewhere else for the night, and if I wanted a hotel the next night I would have to pay and get reimbursed through the booking agency. I told her that was ridiculous because I could not pay up front for anything else. She said if I wanted I could come in the morning and see if they had rooms available. I asked why I couldn't have her reserve my room, especially since it was already reserved, right then. She got mad at me, told me she wasn't even supposed to be there, ripped up my ticket to go to the Marriot, threw it away, and walked off.Of course I got mad, and told her this was horrible customer service and I had every right to be mad at THEIR mistake. Eventually another girl helped me, but I never got a room for the next night, and no one would reimburse me for the nights I paid for up front.This situation happened to about 10 other guests while I was there.Also, an older woman came down as I was there and stated she had been waiting since 4pm for someone to fix her electricity in her bathroom. The girl at the front desk told her she would give her an extension cord to plug a lamp into the bathroom. Great solution.All in all it was horrible, the staff was rude and unapologetic.
Reviews.Author: txaps1234

Reviews.Content: Scam When I checked into the hotel they charged me an additional $5.95 a night for things like breakfast and the use of the business center and safe. The breakfast were some pathetic pastries and coffee and the business center was one computer that didn't work. I can't even remember the other amenities because I didn't use any of them, yet I had no choice whether or not they were going to charge me the $5.95. I'm not sure that's even legal to do, once I'd agreed to one reservation price at time of booking.
Reviews.Author: AustinTraveler57

Reviews.Content: Simple stay outside the Quarter Ten years ago, an older guide book tells me, the Clarion Garden District Hotel was known as the Ramada St. Charles.While the hotel may have seen some better days (during my August 2007 stay, only one elevator was working, paint was peeling in bathrooms), the hotel is still a good destination.I was attracted to it online because it is outside the bustle of the French Quarter (about 5 minutes drive), and parking was free ($15/night at many other hotels in the area). There is also a continental breakfast i.e. lots of coffee and Danish pastry included in the price. The parking and the breakfast probably shave $20/night off equivalent stays elsewhere.Apparently there is a wireless internet service, but I didn't have a computer.It is not particularly soundproof: I could hear the TV from the adjoining room - but my neighbours were all discrete and well-behaved.Staff were efficient and helpful; some details brought to their attention (air conditioner on the blink, loose shower head) were fixed immediately.The neighbourhood is quiet - the St. Charles streetcar is still in its post-Katrina recovery period - and since the free parking lot behind the hotel was often full, or because the spaces were narrow and cramped and I was in an unfamiliar rental car, I generally parked on quiet streets behind the hotel with no problem.Apart from what I paid through an internet package (flight, hotel and car), there is a $5/day local surcharge for services.The chain to which this hotel belongs (Choice Hotels) does not give frequent flyer points to those on discount packages.There is a relatively expensive restaurant (evenings) operating in the hotel (I didn't try it). Otherwise, one has to walk several blocks for another restaurant. (The St. Charles is simple, friendly and open 24 hrs/day).There is a large grocery store just across the street from the hotel which sells take-out sandwiches and other simple meals.
Reviews.Author: Marcil1

Reviews.Content: Huge rooms and free parking! I experienced 3 different rooms and can say they definitely vary in this hotel. The first room I was given, 306, was very nice. It was a very large room with new furniture including a desk and a recliner. There was a new, modern alarm clock/radio/CD player that sounded great. Since the room was only on the 3rd floor, the view wasn't as great as from the upper floors, but looking out over St Charles Av wasn鈥檛 bad either. On my 3rd day there, the toilet overflowed. The bathroom floor was risen above the rest of the floor about an inch or two so the water and sewage came out of the bathroom and poured onto the carpet. I called the main desk and was told that my room would be changed. When I got to the desk, I was told there was a problem. There were no other single rooms available and I would have to be put into a double in the morning and single again in the afternoon.The next room I was given, 812, wasn't very good. It was a double with a great view of the Superdome and downtown New Orleans. However, the chain lock was missing from the door. The room was small and with 2 beds seemed cramped. The table in the room was falling apart and the bathtub had a very slow drain. There were no towels.I was ultimately put into room 921 which had an okay view looking out over the Garden District. The room was large, although not as large as 306, but the furniture and its placement weren't as nice. There was a couch and a cheap alarm clock. Many small crooked pictures on the walls. The lighting in the room wasn't very good and I had difficulty working at the desk at night.The front desk staff were fine - no problems with them. One of the elevators was out so I ended up taking the stairs a lot, even when I was put on the 9th floor. The parking is free; however, it does not seem there are enough spaces for all guests. The hotel is on the eastern tip of the Garden District with some not so great neighborhoods close by so street parking always felt iffy to me. I parked in a fire zone one night and spent 2 hours looking out the window waiting for a spot to become available.I don't want to focus on the negatives. Overall, it's a nice hotel, especially if you score the right room, and a great value. The free parking alone makes it a great choice! Like the rest of New Orleans, I think the hotel is in the middle of renovations. It, and all of New Orleans, needs your business!
Reviews.Author: lemongrrl

Reviews.Content: Good for the price Just returned from a 5 day stay (7/25/07 - 7/30/07). The hotel has seen its day, and showed signs of wear (lobby chair cushions are quite worn), but it is in an excellent location (the Garden District is beautiful), I felt safe, and it was quiet. The Garden District has an old South feel, mint julep, Scarlett O'Hara feel, and this hotel was the closest I could afford to get to the obvious wealth in the area. I read about the Resort fee and the elevator in other reviews, and it was all true. The elevator (only one working for 9 floors of rooms) was rickety, but worked. I only had to wait a long time for the elevator once, and that was during checkout (it was landing short of the floor, and had to be shutdown for a couple of hours to be adjusted). The room was clean and spacious. The beds were comfortable and I had one down-feather pillow! The air was cold and quiet. The carpets seemed clean, but I always wear houseshoes, so that wasn't an issue for me. The towels were above average. The TV worked, and the linens were clean. My room faced Jackson (on the side of the hotel) so street noise was minimal. The room had a stale smell when I arrived, but once I brought my own smells in, it was much fresher.I never ate at the restaurant in the hotel. Next door is a small market that has everything a tourist needs...hot breakfast in the morning (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, etc.) for about $5 and a nice lunch menu. A door from there is a bar/restaurant that has a great menu with New Orleans favorites (gumbo, etoufee, smothered chicken/porkchops, mustard greens, etc.). There are many other restaurants down the block to choose from as well.The St. Charles trolley wasn't running, which was a disappointment, and won't be running until 2008. But the #12 bus stops right near the hotel, and will take you all the way to Bourbon Street and Canal. A cab ride from Bourbon and Canal cost me about $7.50 one way. Not too bad. Overall, for the money and the location, I'd definitely stay there again. It met my expectations (rickety elevators and all)! :-)
Reviews.Author: saverry1

Reviews.Content: Good value Don't be fooled by the negative reviews about this hotel. We had a good experience. It was an excellent value for the $. We are staying there again in August. Sean at the front desk was terrific. The room was clean and spacious. Elevator could use redecorating. Parking was free but one night we had to park on the street due to lack of spaces. No problem, our car was fine and parking was free. Our package included breakfast. It was a take out breakfast from the convenience store next door. It wasn't available on Sunday. It was the same thing every day so we only had it twice.
Reviews.Author: NOLAfan_7

Reviews.Content: NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!! Note, if you are handicapped YOU WILL NOT BE ACCOMMODATED. When planning to stay in New Orleans on the way back from visiting family in Canada, I figured the Garden District Hotel was a safe bet - I'd stayed here about five years ago, and it was a lovely experience. Well, as they say, things change. The trouble began before we even arrived here; earlier in the day before we got to the hotel, we called to make sure we could get a room on the second floor (there are no first floor rooms) since my mother is handicapped and would not be able to walk down many flights of stairs if there was an emergency or the elevator did not work. The first person I spoke to, a young woman, was extremely rude and put me on the phone with someone else named Michael without even telling me she was going to do so. Michael was incredibly rude about the whole thing and told me he'd make NO accommodations for us until I mentioned that I'd spoken to Gerald, the general manager. Suddenly, there was a room on the second floor when Michael had told me flat out that there was nothing below the fourth floor and there was nothing he could or would do. We unpacked and got in the room - I am now terrified of the elevators, they are incredibly rickety and cracking. There are reddish brown (blood?) flecks ALL over the walls, the carpet is dirty (the bottoms of my previously clean feet are now black), and there was actually a condom in the bedside table. Nice! I'm glad my husband and I didn't have children with us! Later, we came to parking. Gerald told us that there was a $20 fee for valet parking, which is how things were several years prior. Well, Gerald lied - there IS no valet parking. You must park yourself, and if all the spaces are taken, you must park on the street. If all THOSE spaces are taken, well, you are SOL, just as Shawn, the night desk worker, told me when I asked him where I should park since there was no parking in the lot or on the street. He told me to keep driving around, that we'd have to find somewhere to park, and I remarked that if people had parked correctly in the lot without taking up five or six spaces, or if they had kept valet parking, there would be no problem. He then threw up his hands and angrily said Well, what do you want ME to do about it? I looked at him and said this hotel was not what it used to be, to which he agreed, and I walked outside. My mother, angry about this, decided to come in. Shawn interrupted and spoke over both of us and denied having said anything rude to me - he said that he'd asked me how he could help me, rather than a flippant What do you want me to do about it. He also said he'd have been more than willing to help us, but then I accused him of being rude, so he wasn't going to help us now. We told him the general manager Gerald had told us there would be valet parking, and that my mother is handicapped and cannot walk long distances and had been assured that everything would be okay. He then waved us off and told us to park in Gerald's space, and if Gerald had a problem with it he'd direct him to us. Well, we took Shawn up on his offer (something he didn't expect us to do) and let the security officer know that Shawn told us to park there so we didn't get towed. As of this writing, I'm sacrificing my sleep to make sure we do not get towed.We had paid $300 for two nights. We are not staying here tomorrow because of all the problems...we're actually willing to sacrifice $150 than stay here one more evening in this sty hole.
Reviews.Author: SpaceCowgrrl

Reviews.Content: If your life isn't perfect then don't book here! I booked this hotel on June 7, 2007 to stay there July 5, 6 and 7 through the corporate website. Prior to booking I had reviewed hotels in the area and found that the free parking was a tremendous asset. After booking my stary, I received a confirmation number and observed that cancellations weren't allowed; since I had planned this vacation for months I knew I had every intention on attending so the no cancellation notice wasn't a problem. However, on June 25, 2007 I learned from my employer that I had been schedule for a promotional interview in Miami Florida on July 6, 2007. I called the hotel and spoke to Michael Glover regarding CHANGING my dates as I would not be able to make it for my originally scheduled dates. To my surprise I was told it was the hotel鈥檚 policy that no cancellations or CHANGES could be made. I informed Mr. Glover that I didn't want I refund, I only wanted a credit that could be used at a later date, I could fax a copy of my interview appointment if necessary. Mr. Glover informed me that there was nothing he could do. I asked for the corporate address and he told me that the hotel was the corporate office (they are independently owned). I was shocked that he wouldn鈥檛 even allow me to come at another time. At this point I realized that the $313.00 I spent booking this hotel was lost simply because life isn't perfect and unforeseen circumstances arise. I know that most people are willing to take chances and see for themselves, but BEWARE this hotel will not work with you if something unexpected happens. Ask yourself if your life is perfect before you book. It is my prayer that we as humans evolve to a point where we can make money and still be decent human beings.
Reviews.Author: mimi0223

Reviews.Content: Old Charm and brass fitted elevators I am a native who picked this hotel due to price and location. I couldn't get family to assess it so called the Better Business Bureau and got reassured. Upon arrival I found my room had lagniappe a little refrigerator and safe (Me I got no jewels cher) . The staff was accommodating, friendly and professional and I enjoyed swapping storm stories with them. The hot tub was out on a small balcony where I could star gaze, listen to the river traffic, feel the breeze and smell wet live oak trees in the rain. If you need good sleep in a clean room at reasonable price stay here. The hotel has a business center, weight room and free parking. It is close enough to the quarter that you could conceivably walk. Ordinarily the street car ride to town is way cool but (ala Katrina) its' the bus for $1.00. I want tourists to pass a good time and get their monies worth therefore I recommend the Garden District Hotel. It has stood the test of time with grace, brass fitted elevators and comes complete with local staff that know how to treat a guest.
Reviews.Author: nanirobin

Reviews.Content: Never again! Shabby is not chique. First, the small elevators were delapidated with peeling paint and missing areas on the floor. When we entered the room there was a large blower fan running. I assumed there was some type of spill that had been cleaned, since the room smelled slightly of vomit and mildew. We asked the front desk to remove the fan to no avail. The fan remained in our bathroom for our stay. The bathroom was missing floor tiles and frankly we were afraid to take a shower. There was free parking and a free breakfast with a limited, high fat menu at the dingy store next to the hotel. We would not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: MetairieGirl

Reviews.Content: Wedding Nightmare I am not usually one to complain. I had visited the Garden District Hotel and knew what to expect. I knew this was an older hotel, but it was located across the street from the House of Broel, where I was getting married. I booked a group block of rooms for my guests. Apparently, the group sales manger left in the process of me getting the contract signed and the new sales manger had not a clue what was going on. Some of my guests were told that there were no more rooms blocked off for my weeding, some were told they had reservations, only to find out later they did not. My aunt called 3 times to book a room, and then when I called to confirm, guess what....no room. The week before the wedding I was in touch with the new sales manager no less than once a day confirming rooms. Each day a different list of reservations appeared. Finally on the day before we would arrive, I felt everything was good to go. At least that is what the sales manager told me repeatedly. But on Friday, when all of my guests were scheduled to arrive....guess what.... some of my guests STILL had no rooms. And to top it all off, they had overbooked, so they began WALKING my guests to another hotle. Because of this fiasco, I spent the night trying to fix all of this and so nicely missed my OWN Rehearsal dinner! The front desk was very nice, but had no clue what was going on, and the sales manager (which by the way I never saw) was contacted by phone, but basically threw her hands up and kept telling me over the phone that it was right. My room was huge, and I liked it very much, but other guests had problems with clogged sinks and dirty rooms.if you are planning a group occassion, I would definately suggest finding another hotel to plan it!
Reviews.Author: Jae_Rae

Reviews.Content: An "alright" Hotel Booked this hotel for the Easter weekend, got a great deal for about 50 dollars a night. Since it's located in the Garden District, the neighborhood is beautiful and quiet. NOW, the Hotel... Front desk staff were very friendly and let us check into our room early. The elevators are pretty old, but still in working function. Rooms were pretty spacious and the beds were comfortable. However, the rooms didhave an old kind of smell, the ceiling had some stains (I'm assuming it's from a previous leak) and the sink in the bathroom was clogged. Overall, if you're not a picky person, and you're not in your room very much, then this hotel is okay. However, if you're looking for grand luxury, or have a little more money to spend on a hotel, I would suggest otherwise.
Reviews.Author: boricuapapi8705

Reviews.Content: Good location, large rooms I booked through Hotwire service featured on Orbitz and Expedia. Rate was $57 a night for a Three Star Hotel in the Garden District. The tax is 13% and like most NO hotels booked via third party, the hotel adds its own 'resort charge of 5.95 per night for unlimited phone, wireless Internet, business computer access and gym with hot tub. Total was closer to $70 per night with taxes, fees and tips, but worth it. Room was spacious, and the bathroom had separate dressing/sink area from toilet/shower. Very comfortable for two people sharing - I requested two beds, which were quite comfortable. It's not swank, and the elevator was slow. The walls are thin, and I could hear voices and television in adjoining rooms, but basically it was pretty quiet. There was generally only one person at the reception desk which made service there slow. (Common in NO -- lots of staffing shortages.) The hot tub on the balcony overlooking St. Charles was nice, but it was not operating my last day there. Very good location in Garden District with a small market and several barbeque places across the street. There is also an upscale restaurant, Vizards, in the hotel, but I did not eat there. It was pricey but looked good. The hotel is right on the St. Charles bus line, which costs 1.25 exact change, and is a ten minute ride to the French Quarter. Taxi to Harrah's casino on near the Aquarium cost 5.50+ tip. This hotel is a good deal at the right price, which obviously varies according to demand. It is currently listed at $175 per night during jazz festival! The hotel does not meet that sort of luxury standard and should only be booked as an good economical choice, not an upscale offering.
Reviews.Author: sohokat

Reviews.Content: Nice, Friendly Hotel - Great Rates We got an unbelieveable rate at the Garden District Hotel, no valet charges, close to fun bars and great restaurants (they have a 4 star restaurant Vizards in the hotel)! The lobby is very nice and the staff was extremely helpful. We liked it because the money we saved on the room we could spend on food and sight seeing. When you come to New Orleans you don't spend time sitting in your room all day and night. If you want to do that you should spend $400 a night and stay at the Ritz! The rooms were very clean. The housekeeping staff was very good and the linens were new and fresh. The GM told us they were renovating the hotel and they are doing it without tearing everything up so the guests really aren't even aware of the work being done. If you want to go to NO for a weekend and want to spend your money on things other than your hotel bill you should check this place out. We thought it was Great!
Reviews.Author: travellingal60

Reviews.Content: Never Stay Here I got this hotel last minute and expected a 3 star hotel. It was not. I was not given the room I was promised. The wall paper was peeling off the elevators, the elevators only worked sometimes which was the same problem with the air conditioning and the suposed internet (neither worked). I had left something in my room when I checked out and called them 3 times to ask about it and they still have never returned a call or told me what happened to it. NEVER STAY HERE. It was AWFUL.
Reviews.Author: lweber

Reviews.Content: 2 Star Hotel We stayed here Thursday Feb 15th which was the Thursday before Mardi Gras. We already had hotel reservations downtown for the remainder of the weekend but decided to come into New Orleans early so we needed a cheap hotel last minute. I got a room at the Garden District Hotel online at Hotwire.com for $40/night. I was apprehensive of staying there based on the previous reviews but figured that we could deal with most anything for one night. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel. The enterance is very nice and the staff was also pleasant. We were able to park for free in their lot behind the hotel. However, if we were staying for more than one night I would have been worried about the security of our car (the lot is well lit but does not having a locking gate).The elevator was very old  only one worked. Our room was on the top floor and also looked very old. However, it was clear that the linens/bedspread/towels were all brand new.... which made me feel much better. I know this hotel used to be owned by Ramada (and wasn't known to be the best hotel back then either...) when I lived in New Orleans (back in 2004)... and I think now that it is owned by Clarion they are trying to make it at least a little bit better. In sum, its a 2 star hotel that will do if you need to stay here because of scheduling or budget. However, I wouldn't choose this hotel as a relaxing hotel to stay while vacationing in New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: MikahDog

Reviews.Content: just 'OK' hotel, near to magazine street, friendly staff ...some reviews from 2005 were outdated, so i wanted to be sure to update you. Stayed here with a friend in NOLA who was in for business before and over new years., where another business associate chose this hotel for 1) proximity to their company 2) hotel parking lot (valet) for rental car 3) to be away from french quarter noise on business trip (side note: There were rooms available on NYE, and the hotel posted a large sign to that extent out on their fence). the staff was very friendly and accommodating. this was an OK room, but did smell musty as in other reviews. also the one elevator was broken requiring long waits or stairs. Some positives - one free internet computer in the lobby, St. Charles street had some good restaurants within walking distance of hotel, in fact, the restaurant in the hotel is getting great reviews. Also magazine street was about 5 ?blocks away. (If its your first time to this area, note that magazine street is said to be six miles long - so the rental car we had was key to exploring the entire street - - however, you could look at www.magazinestreet.com to see what stores are where, and also there is a city bus that goes up and down magazine st. (not sure of how often) Cabs to the french quarter were about 10$. Unfortunately during our visit, the St. Charles ST. trolley was not up and running (tracks in front of hotel) by the hotel, however with about an 8? block walk (daytime) toward French Quarter, you could take the trolley from the General Lee statue on CHarles the remaining 8? blocks to Canal street.
Reviews.Author: travel_is_gr8

Reviews.Content: Won't stay here again One thing many travelers don't realize is that the Central City and the Garden District sit right next to each other. I don't know where the demarcation lines are exactly but this hotel was much more Central City than Garden District in that it had been allowed to lapse into disrepair and neglect. The lobby seemed inviting enough but the room was not something I would ever take my family to again. The condition of the hotel is exemplified by the fact that, on our room at least, the room number was written on the door with magic marker. Rugs were dirty, musty, bathroom in definite decline.The neighborhood had lots of younger kids hangin', and there were police cars stationed on the corners. This was the weekend that the National guard had been called into town and also when the first big convention had come to post-Katrina NOLA. We had a change in plans and had to stay another night so I booked this hotel, which had vacancies, online and in a hurry.Things may have been better pre-K but this is not a hotel I will ever stay at again.
Reviews.Author: hoopjnky

Reviews.Content: Avoid like the plague       Peeling, mouldy wallpaper
Reviews.Author: Mandelbrot

Reviews.Content: Thin walls, smelly rooms, highly Un-Recommended When I walked into my room, I thought, You get what you pay for But after talking to others staying in hotels closer to the french quarter that are paying 25% less than me, I realized that I was getting ripped off.My room smells like dog urine (they allow pets here, so it doesn't surprise me that my room stinks), the walls between rooms are so thin that I can hear the conversation, word-for-word, next door as well as when their cell phone vibrates on their table in the middle of the night. I am generally a heavy sleeper, but this is crazy.I definitely recommend looking around for something else, and this should be your last resort in case there is nothing else available.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, good location Overall our stay at this hotel was good. The staff was pleasant and helpfull, giving us some very good suggestions on restaurants. The rooms and hotel are basic. The location is great, being midway between the French Quarter and Audubon Park and within walking distance of many restaurants and a few shops. Be sure to negotiate for the best rate ( we found a discount coupon at the Louisiana Visitors Center that they honored). Also, watch out for extra charges on the bill, such as the safe charge and any phone calls.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: thank's Emily our first trip to new orleans. and it was great! including our stay at this little hotel. we booked the room about 6 month's in advance and dealt over the phone with Emily, who took very good care of us . it seem's they are continueing to do there upgrades without closing the doors so there were some little mishaps that the manager took care of for us promptly. like the fire alarm going of at 1:30 am due to renovation's but the manager paid us back for that night and with sensere apologies. we stayed here for five days from feb 7th to the 11th and quiet enjoyed it.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hidden charges abound at the Garden District Hotel This is an appallingly mediocre accomodation that benefits from a good location. The rooms are nothing special, the lobby mundane, the restaurant's food and service average and slow, respectively. As referenced by previous reviewers management has come up with the scheme of charging an internet booking fee as well as an in-room safe fee. I protested upon check-in that I would not use the safe, but got nowhere in my arguments with the manager on duty. The hotel has a guard on duty in the parking lot whose sole duty is to push a button on a remote to open a gate. He does a great job if you can catch him between naps!!! New Orleans is full of much nicer hotels in as good as or better locations as this one. Take your business elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in Unique Location We stayed at this charming little hotel in the Garden District and really enjoyed our visit. The staff always approached us to provide assistance and information. Great value and service!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: OK........... My wife and I stayed here in May and had a mostly positive experience. The bad: musty smell in lobby, elevators are small and slow, bathroom needed an overhaul (but was clean). The good: front desk service was great, location, everything in room worked. This place probably should be gutted and replaced because of age but if you can get a good price on internet(I did) it is an option if you want to stay in a convenient part of the Garden District. The service we were granted is due to the fact that I called the hotel on numerous times before our visit and had a great relationship with the people there before arriving. We got a great room (ask for view of St. Charles) and every request we made was taken care. In contrast, our friends from Fla. had a very bad experience the same weekend (lost reservations, wrong pricing, small roon, etc.) I will not be staying here again since there are many choices.
Reviews.Author: jck

Reviews.Content: Horrible! My husband and I have been to New Orleans every year for Mardi Gras for over ten years now, and this is the absolute worst hotel we have ever encountered. I have read some other reviews posted and we had the same problems. We were repeatedly locked out of our own hotel room, and had to wait for maintenance to let us in several times. Our toilet either did not flush, or even worse--overflowed in our already dirty bathroom. The water pressure in the shower was comparable to standing in a light rain. We had to pay $30/day for valet parking, which was a semi-locked, uncovered lot behind the hotel. A couple we met outside during the parades told us that their hotel room had actually caught fire - and they had to be moved to the Pontchartrain next door. They were lucky. Management was unsympathetic. We will never, ever stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Moldy, smelly, ripped off! Would NEVER stay here again! It was so bad that we moved to another hotel as soon as they would let us. The whole hotel smelled incredibly MOLDY and foul, and there was actually black mold and mildew noted on the wallpaper in our room. The safe we were required to pay for did not work, and we had a file of personal CD's and DVD's stolen from our luggage with no apology from the management, even when we complained that we noted the rooms were cleaned with the doors kept shut by the staff which spoke and understood no English. The water didn't work for one night, and the toilets continually flushed keeping us awake for one night--again, no apology. When we tried to check out early, we were told that we had to pay for two more nights, even though we had serious issues with the room. We tried the small restaurant once for breakfast, and were appalled at the service and selection, and went to McDonald's the next day. I almost reported the place to the local health authorities.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Brief visit to New Orleans Upon arriving in the Garden District of New Orleans the night of our first stay, we were informed at the Garden District Hotel that our room was not available due to overbooking. We had booked our hotel room with Hotels. Our first night was spent in a room downtown at the Queen  Crescent Hotel. New Orleans is a fun city with ambiance unique to the big easy. Our favorite haunt is the Cafe DuMonde on Decatur in the Quarter. New Orleans is always alive for all to enjoy.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Garden District Hotel Overcharges with Internet Booking fee At check-out at The Garden District Hotel, 2203 St. Charles Ave, we were presented with an internet booking internet fee of $2.95. This appears to be a totally bogus fee since there are no additional costs to the hotel for internet booking vs. any other kind of booking. Also, no other hotel in New Orleans or elsewhere has ever charged me such a fee. This hotel also charged an in-room safe fee of $1.95; other hotels in New Orleans also charge this fee and this hotel justified it because there was a small sign on the check-in counter. The difference between this hotel and other hotels: At other hotels when I have stated that I didn't use the safe and did not want to pay it, they took it off the bill. This hotel did not.In effect, this hotel gets to quote a price $5 lower than their competition to get the same money from a customer.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very disappointing... This hotel's only redeeming quality is its proximity to the streetcar line. We stayed there for Mardi Gras weekend '04 and experienced several problems. An elevator motor fire rendered one of the obsolete, 6-person elevators useless, leaving only one to service 9 floors at maximum occupancy. The staff seemed unconcerned and unsympathetic, and made no attempt to repair the other elevator. It took forever to get to and from our room. The tub wouldn't drain, the A/C did not work, and light bulbs were out despite notifying the front desk of these problems. There was an additional charge to use the in room safe, and valet parking was exorbitant! While the room was large, the TV was small (19); there was no room service available and no vending machines for soft drinks or snacks. Getting ice required the dreaded, lengthy wait for an elevator ride. We also had to wear stupid wristbands at all times because it was Mardi Gras, but only once did hotel security check for them, and I saw plenty of people in the hotel not wearing them. A door marked exit at the end of our corridor led only to a blind eighth floor balcony, with no fire ladder or stairs - I suppose you could jump to your death from there to the parking lot below, but I wouldn't consider it an exit. I was not at all happy with this hotel, especially at the rate of $209 per night! This hotel is due for modernization, and I cannot, in good conscience, recommend it.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hated it!! We stayed at this hotel for Mardi Gras this year. The hotel appeared poorly managed. We were locked out of our room 3 times and had to have mechanism on door fixed. Manager was not apologetic, Also, the pipe under the bathroom sink completely came apart, they repaired it but never vacuumed up all the water so we had wet carpet in our room. All the equipment is old. The elevator didn't work so we spent our trip climbing up and down stairs. When they did fix it they only allowed 6 people on the working elevator. The hotel was full capacity. The second elevator never worked. The wallpaper and painting in hotel was old adn poorly done. OUr wallpaper in our room had patched in spots and the tile in the bathroom was broken and had holes in it. Also, alot of rust around bathroom fixtures. There are no amenities. I would not recommend anyone to stay here unless your expectations are low. Also, they charge 30 dollars for parking per day when the other hotels charge 20 dollars.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Value No problems with this hotel at all, everything worked, the rooms were clean, and the service was good. Bear in mind this is quite a cheap hotel, so you will not feel like a movie star while walking through its lobby. But if want you want is a functional clean room, that is what you will get. Only complaint is that the laundry charges were outrageous (hence the reason why the bar next door has washing machines next to the pool tables). Location is good, probably better for those who are after the garden district and magazine street experience. Bourbon street is about 10 minutes away by streetcar ($1.25) or $10 cabfare. I d stay there again.PS New Orleans is a fabulous town, a week or two there is not long enough
Reviews.Author: Phurge

Reviews.Content: Okay..... Found this place based on the reviews...was expecting a little better. The hotel is old and they haven't put too much money into updating it really. The staff was great to us. We asked for extra towels and were given them immediately. Our hot water did not work either, and evidently, the maid had reported it and it was fixed the next day. I couldn't be bothered complaining. They were great about holding our bags the day we were leaving and calling for a taxi, which arrived promptly as well. (btw...saw a ton of people using the Shuttle to/from the airport..don't know why because the taxi's are actually less expensive and get you to your location with no additional stops!) Considering we were only in our room for an hour in the morning, same at mid-day and came home late to just go to bed...it did the trick. The walls are thin and the noise, if you have loud neighbors, is very evident. The hotel location is good though, and worth getting the trolley to and from--buy a day pass..worth it 'cause you can use it on Decatur street in town as well.As far as what to do....need to do Commander's Palace...food was FABULOUS and service impeccable. Worth dressing up Do lunch....more affordable and 25 cent martinis!!! Also, Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville was actually nice...good easy listening jazz and blues...laid back and affordable. The free ferry ride is good..not a lot to do over on the other side, but the Dry Dock Cafe had lunch and drinks....we relaxed away from the hustle and bustle and did MANY drinks and 3 meals for less than $35!! Good deal. Magazine Street has great shopping in certain areas and the Columns Hotel is a nice relaxing place for a drink/coffee in the middle of the day.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not Happy with this hotel! My husband and I stayed at this hotel December 5-8 2003. I was not very happy with this place at all. The first day we had no wash clothes and asked for them over and over. The next day after housekeeping came we had neither wash clothes or towels. And took repeated attempts to get them as well. We had booked and paid three months in advance with continental breakfast supposed to be part of our package which was not offered. But we were told to eat in their high priced restaurant. When I checked out I asked for compensation for not having the breakfast and asked for it to be taken off our parking bill. And they argued with me and after 10 minutes reluctantly gave me 18.00 off. I would not stay here again. The drains in the bathtub were very slow to drain, and the hotel fixtures were in disrepair. It was not that clean either. I read the other reviews here and that made me choose it, because it was rated highly by others. I found it was not worth it, and would not stay there again
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
